Params: The large caretaker mechanoid falls down, the last trace of her discontent dissipating in the dark basement as her digital voice turns silent.

Finally defeating the enemy, Bambinata loses the will to hold on. Only then does Vanessa realize that her frame is heavily damaged. She should have avoided fighting in a way that further damaged her body when she could.
Some of the vital fluid tubings are torn and require immediate attention. Her leg mounting plates need to be replaced as well.
Don't look at me like that. I'm a Support-type Construct, after all.
You should stay here with dollface and maintain a Deep M.I.N.D. connection with her. You stabilize her M.I.N.D., and I'll grab some supplies from the transport craft.
The clicking sound of Vera's heels gradually fades away, and the large circular room is quiet once more.
Vanessa lays Bambinata's head on her thighs the same way Bambinata took care of her during the battle where they stayed behind for Gray Raven.
Bambinata had a very, very long dream, Mistress.
Bambinata dreamed about a large house that she shared with you... And Father and Mother in the lab coats they always wore... You were the same height as Bambinata in the beginning, Mistress...
You taught Bambinata to cover up her belly when she napped and how not to make a sound stirring her coffee. You showed Bambinata how to do her hair and how to stand straight...

You told Bambinata many things she doesn't hear nowadays. Your confusion after your hard work, your disappointment, and discontent... Bambinata doesn't want them anywhere near you, Mistress. Bambinata wants to chase them away every time she hears about them.
The way you danced, the way you said goodnight, the way you read... You probably don't know about the drawings Bambinata secretly made... but Bambinata doesn't remember where they are now.
Bambinata always wanted to draw herself with you in those pictures, but... what should Bambinata look like?
Bambinata couldn't figure out what shape she should take, so she never knew how to tell you her thoughts.
If Bambinata could make that dream again, she'd tell Father and Mother it was her idea to stand with you, Mistress. It was something Bambinata must do.
Even without an order... No—even if it went against an order, Bambinata would tell you how she felt at the risk of being discarded.
Those unfinished drawings... There would have been fewer blank spaces in them if only Bambinata had understood this sooner...
Vanessa hides her face in the shadow, keeping her expression away from Bambinata.
She suddenly remembers the days and nights she has since forsaken and how there was always a pair of blue eyes watching her.
She wanted to be heard, comforted, seen, and recognized.
She wanted her solitude to be shared and her feelings to be understood.
She took the first step. Why did those eyes turn away?
Fearing that she would be alone and had to admit defeat, she decided to take control instead, fully and unrelentingly—that way, at least she could get those eyes back on her.
After getting what she wanted by taking a shortcut, only now does she get the answer she has been waiting for.
We've been observing her continuously since she arrived from Star of Life yesterday afternoon.

She woke up a few times since then, and Rosa performed M.I.N.D. calibration every time. There is no sign that Bambinata's M.I.N.D. has had any significant alterations from the damage, judging from the results.
What does that mean? No significant alterations?
Your report mentions Bambinata having memory flashbacks on the surface and being controlled by the enemy mechanoid, right?
It's common for Contructs to have M.I.N.D. deviations or disturbances in situations like this, or we might find traces of enemy data left behind. But Bambinata's current state is the same as always.
Most of the damage is only seen on the Inver-Device. There don't seem to be other after-effects.

I'm guessing that the mechanoid's "controlling" behavior is an evolution of her experimental function. The memory shell you retrieved contains its code and a complete research log that echos how it acted attacking you.
As for the memory flashbacks, I suppose it might be a symptom of the sudden impact of the highly concentrated Punishing Virus on her M.I.N.D. and the Inver-Device.
But I can't rule out that it might be related to the experiment Bambinata was involved in either...
Even Asimov does not realize he is lowering his voice when he speaks about this.
Perhaps the mechanoid accidentally triggered some kind of response from the experiment when it tried to interfere with Bambinata's Inver-Device.
It's good that the after-effects were gone once we repaired the Inver-Device.
Is the memory data of this mission recorded in her external memory module?

Regrettably, no. The module was formatted once we were told that an enemy had taken control of the Construct. From what I've been told, the Cerberus Construct on the mission is under inspection as well.
...Tch. I suppose he's the only one with the clearance to do so.
I took some data snapshots before it was formatted, hoping that I can learn something useful regarding Construct amnesia after I finish analyzing the data in the mechanoid's memory shell.
So the things we retrieved are in your hands now?
That's right. If you don't have other questions, I should go back to analyzing the retrieved samples.
Asimov? Sorry to bother you. Are you available right now?
President Hassen is hoping you can visit the conference room now.

Asimov grabs the files on the desk and prepares to leave the observation room, but he quickly turns back and points at the door to the inner chamber, indicating to Vanessa that she can bring Bambinata away.
Hearing her mistress calling, the sleeping Construct opens her eyes instantly.
There's nothing else to do today. You can go back to the lounge directly later.
Did Bambinata do something wrong during the mission? The data in the external memory module... wasn't operated by you, Mistress.
You did nothing wrong. We just took your external memory module for maintenance when you weren't awake.
Don't overthink. I know... what you want to say.
It's fine if you want to keep an eye on me. Can you do it out of my sight, though?
I haven't been able to move around for the past few days. Don't tempt me with your punchable face.

The two Construct soldiers leave the room upon receiving the order. The bulky door closes once again, and Vera finally relaxes and sits down, awaiting the other end of the call to explain her current situation.
The inspection is over. Your M.I.N.D. doesn't have any after-effects from this mission. You can leave soon.
You ought to know that from the start.
Sure, but this is still a necessary step.
You knew I couldn't have come into contact with anyone from Kurono privately.
What is that supposed to mean?
From now on, all private interactions of yours are considered expressly permitted. If you ever need to compile two mission reports, send me a copy directly through the encrypted channel.
There may still be "necessary steps" every now and then, but I guarantee it won't harm you and especially not the Cerberus members.
What about the other thing you promised?
That's another story. I told you in our encrypted messages—take care of the things you retrieve before handing them in, and I'll take care of the preparations for the next phase.
Once the Science Council completes the full report, the result will be plain to see in no time.
And Kurono? What if no one contacts me? I can't just gift-wrap and deliver myself.
Don't you worry about that. All you need to do is take the bait when someone's fishing.
If you don't have other questions, this is the official end of your inspection.
Although she has known her role as a Construct for a very long time, Vera is still bothered by being wielded by external forces she cannot control.
But when she thinks of the two Constructs who are messing around in the lounge while they wait for her return, she reckons this is a mess worth getting into.
Oh? I was wondering who it is. If it isn't the remarkable Captain Vera! The inspection must not have been enjoyable, I assume?
Oh, isn't that the Egret Commandant who insisted on following her Construct on a surface mission? How devoted you are to dollface there. You're picking her up from maintenance yourself!
Isn't it normal for one to fully exhaust her toy for a few more days before getting a new one?
I wonder who it was that got so worried when she lost her doll. Thank you, by the way, for showcasing that exceptional range of emotions on your "pretty" face.

Vanessa furrows her brows from Vera's mockery. Right as she is about to respond, Vera waves and departs, saying, "Thank you for your wonderful performance, mistress and maid. Good luck, your highness."
Vanessa closes her eyes to calm herself down. After a while, she opens her eyes and chuckles.
...Haha, you too. I should save my breath instead of arguing with a Construct like you.
The two of them are both relentless with their insults, but Bambinata does not feel hostility between them. If anything, she senses a peculiar rapport.
The obedient puppet follows her mistress, going through three hallways before returning to the Egret lounge.
Peaceful sunlight showers the corridors, casting their shadows on the reflective walls: one in the front, one in the back.
The obedient puppet never deviates from her mistress' pace, always following her mistress from behind.
As long as her frame is needed. As long as her name is called.
No matter how tomorrow repeats, Bambinata will never fear waking up from nothingness.
